intro: Acetosella mandioccana, commonly known as the Brazilian spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in early spring, typically in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and arranged in a compact rosette. Acetosella mandioccana thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
